intro: Verbascum microcymosum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, fuzzy, gray-green leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Verbascum microcymosum is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
